name: Panagiotis Charalampopoulos
content: Panagiotis Charalampopoulos Panagiotis Charalampopoulos Home Publications Teaching Service Address Department of Informatics King's College London Bush House, 30 Aldwych, London, WC2B 4BG Email p.charalampopoulos[at]kcl.ac.uk I am a Lecturer (Assistant Professor) in the Department of Informatics at King's College London. Prior to that, I was a Lecturer in the School of Computing and Mathematical Sciences at Birkbeck, University of London. Earlier, I was a postdoctoral fellow in the Efi Arazi School of Computer Science at Reichman University (IDC Herzliya) hosted by Shay Mozes and Oren Weimann (University of Haifa). I completed my Ph.D. studies in Computer Science in the Department of Informatics at King's College London under the supervision of Tomasz Radzik and Solon P. Pissis. During my Ph.D. studies, I completed a 6-month research internship in the Institute of Informatics at the University of Warsaw hosted by Jakub Radoszewski and a 5-month research internship at IDC Herzliya. Research Interests I am interested in algorithms and data structures, with a focus on strings and planar graphs. Selected Publications Strings Pattern Matching under Weighted Edit Distance [arxiv] P.
